item.title: Today in History
item.description: Today is Saturday, June 16, the 168th day of 2012. There are 198 days left in the year.

item.title: Stuntman Nik Wallenda completes tightrope walk across Niagara Falls
item.description: NIAGARA FALLS, New York (Reuters) - Aerialist Nik Wallenda made a historic tightrope crossing over Niagara Falls on Friday night, stepping onto safe ground in Canada to wild cheers after completing his journey through wind and mist on a 2-inch (5-cm) cable. Wallenda, a member of the famed "Flying Wallendas" family of aerialists, took a little more than 25 minutes to walk 1,800 feet from the U.S. side in the dark of night over treacherous waters and rocks in a nationally televised event. ...
item.media:text: NIAGARA FALLS, New York (Reuters) - Aerialist Nik Wallenda made a historic tightrope crossing over Niagara Falls on Friday night, stepping onto safe ground in Canada to wild cheers after completing his journey through wind and mist on a 2-inch (5-cm) cable. Wallenda, a member of the famed "Flying Wallendas" family of aerialists, took a little more than 25 minutes to walk 1,800 feet from the U.S. side in the dark of night over treacherous waters and rocks in a nationally televised event. ...

item.title: 3 dead, 1 critical after Canada campus shooting
item.description: Police were searching Friday for a security company employee charged with murder in the attempted robbery of an armored truck at a western Canada university that left three armed guards dead, police said.
item.media:text: Police were searching Friday for a security company employee charged with murder in the attempted robbery of an armored truck at a western Canada university that left three armed guards dead, police said.

item.title: Spurs PG Tony Parker hurt in Drake-Brown brawl
item.description: San Antonio Spurs guard Tony Parker says he suffered a scratched retina on one of his eyes during a New York City nightclub brawl involving singer Chris Brown and members of hip-hop star Drake's entourage.

item.title: AP Photos: Wallenda's trek across Niagara Falls
item.description: With thousands of fans riveted on his every step, daredevil Nik Wallenda walks 1,800 feet on a tightrope spanning across the mist-fogged Niagara Falls.
item.media:text: With thousands of fans riveted on his every step, daredevil Nik Wallenda walks 1,800 feet on a tightrope spanning across the mist-fogged Niagara Falls.

item.title: Hurricane Carlotta makes landfall in Mexico
item.description: Hurricane Carlotta slammed into Mexico's resort-studded Pacific coast late Friday, toppling trees and lashing hotels while authorities evacuated people from low-lying areas.
item.media:text: Hurricane Carlotta slammed into Mexico's resort-studded Pacific coast late Friday, toppling trees and lashing hotels while authorities evacuated people from low-lying areas.

item.title: Film returns Travolta to spotlight, amid bad press
item.description: John Travolta will soon be back on the big screen, but weeks of negative headlines have focused on his personal life and not on the return of one of Hollywood's top stars.
item.media:text: John Travolta will soon be back on the big screen, but weeks of negative headlines have focused on his personal life and not on the return of one of Hollywood's top stars.

item.title: Woods shares US Open lead with Furyk, Toms
item.description: There were no fist pumps for Tiger Woods, just a deep breath and a slow exhale. Jim Furyk walked most of the 7,170 yards at Olympic Club with his head down. David Toms couldn't think of a single shot he hit without his full attention Friday.
item.media:text: There were no fist pumps for Tiger Woods, just a deep breath and a slow exhale. Jim Furyk walked most of the 7,170 yards at Olympic Club with his head down. David Toms couldn't think of a single shot he hit without his full attention Friday.

item.title: District: Texas teacher had kids hit alleged bully
item.description: A Texas teacher will lose her job after ordering more than 20 kindergartners to line up and hit a classmate accused of being a bully, a district spokesman said Friday.

item.title: Japan OKs restart of 1st reactors since tsunami
item.description: Japan's government on Saturday approved bringing the country's first nuclear reactors back online since last year's earthquake and tsunami led to a shutdown of reactors nationwide.
item.media:text: Japan's government on Saturday approved bringing the country's first nuclear reactors back online since last year's earthquake and tsunami led to a shutdown of reactors nationwide.

item.title: Scientists to strap cameras to Hawaiian seals
item.description: Hawaiian monk seals need an image makeover.
item.media:text: Hawaiian monk seals need an image makeover.

item.title: Tethered Wallenda walks wire across Niagara Falls
item.description: Daredevil Nik Wallenda became the first person to walk on a tightrope across the Niagara Falls, taking steady, measured steps Friday night for 1,800 feet across the mist-fogged brink of the roaring falls separating the U.S. and Canada.
item.media:text: Daredevil Nik Wallenda became the first person to walk on a tightrope across the Niagara Falls, taking steady, measured steps Friday night for 1,800 feet across the mist-fogged brink of the roaring falls separating the U.S. and Canada.

item.title: Hurricane Carlotta makes landfall in Mexican
item.description: Hurricane Carlotta has come ashore in Mexico with winds of 90 mph (150 kph).
item.media:text: Hurricane Carlotta has come ashore in Mexico with winds of 90 mph (150 kph).

item.title: Hurricane Carlotta nears resorts on Mexican coast
item.description: Carlotta grew into a powerful Category 2 hurricane on Friday as it neared Mexico's southern Pacific coast, where it is expected to brush the resort town of Puerto Escondido and then lash Acapulco.
item.media:text: Carlotta grew into a powerful Category 2 hurricane on Friday as it neared Mexico's southern Pacific coast, where it is expected to brush the resort town of Puerto Escondido and then lash Acapulco.

item.title: Romney says immigration decision complicates issue
item.description: Softening his rhetoric on immigration, likely Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney said Friday that the status of younger illegal immigrants was important and should be addressed with legislation. He would not say if he would reverse President Barack Obama's decision to stop deporting some who came to the U.S. as children.
item.media:text: Softening his rhetoric on immigration, likely Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney said Friday that the status of younger illegal immigrants was important and should be addressed with legislation. He would not say if he would reverse President Barack Obama's decision to stop deporting some who came to the U.S. as children.

item.title: Report: LA Wal-Mart lobbyist posed as reporter
item.description: An associate at a lobbying firm tapped to bring a Walmart store to downtown Los Angeles has left the firm after she posed as a reporter at a news conference held by a labor group that opposed the big-box store.

item.title: Police: Breakup led NY doctor to kill lover, self
item.description: A former Army weapons expert wanted for fatally shooting his ex-girlfriend killed himself with a gunshot to the head, quelling the risk of more bloodshed and silencing perhaps the only voice that might have answered the central question: Was a break-up enough to cause a gifted trauma surgeon widely beloved as a lifesaver to end two lives in a spasm of violence?
item.media:text: A former Army weapons expert wanted for fatally shooting his ex-girlfriend killed himself with a gunshot to the head, quelling the risk of more bloodshed and silencing perhaps the only voice that might have answered the central question: Was a break-up enough to cause a gifted trauma surgeon widely beloved as a lifesaver to end two lives in a spasm of violence?

item.title: Jury orders 'Pacman' Jones to pay $11 million
item.description: Cincinnati Bengals cornerback Adam "Pacman" Jones must pay $11 million in damages to two Las Vegas strip club employees injured in 2007 when a lone gunman claiming he was doing Jones' bidding opened fire outside the club.

item.title: Upstart Stony Brook loses 9-1 to UCLA in CWS debut
item.description: So much for shocking the world. This time Stony Brook got zapped.
item.media:text: So much for shocking the world. This time Stony Brook got zapped.

item.title: Ban on Scottish school lunch blog lifted
item.description: A Scottish local authority has lifted its ban stopping a nine-year-old Scottish girl from photographing her school lunches and posting them on her blog, after the move sparked outrage online.
item.media:text: A Scottish local authority has lifted its ban stopping a nine-year-old Scottish girl from photographing her school lunches and posting them on her blog, after the move sparked outrage online.

item.title: UCLA beats upstart Stony Brook 9-1 in CWS opener
item.description: UCLA didn't take long to suck the life out of a College World Series crowd that wanted to see that lovable team from Long Island win yet another game during its amazing postseason run.
item.media:text: UCLA didn't take long to suck the life out of a College World Series crowd that wanted to see that lovable team from Long Island win yet another game during its amazing postseason run.

item.title: Woods stumbles after taking US Open lead
item.description: Tiger Woods briefly seized the US Open lead early in his second round at The Olympic Club, but he was soon back in a pack that included 17-year-old US amateur Beau Hossler.
item.media:text: Tiger Woods briefly seized the US Open lead early in his second round at The Olympic Club, but he was soon back in a pack that included 17-year-old US amateur Beau Hossler.

item.title: Column: McIlroy the 'next Tiger Woods?' Not yet.
item.description: A year after posting the lowest score ever to win the U.S. Open and being anointed the latest "next Tiger Woods," Rory McIlroy won't be around for the weekend to defend his title.
item.media:text: A year after posting the lowest score ever to win the U.S. Open and being anointed the latest "next Tiger Woods," Rory McIlroy won't be around for the weekend to defend his title.

item.title: Calif. lawmakers pass budget, but work unfinished
item.description: California lawmakers passed a $92 billion budget Friday to keep their paychecks coming, but they left welfare cuts and other difficult issues unresolved with Gov. Jerry Brown.
item.media:text: California lawmakers passed a $92 billion budget Friday to keep their paychecks coming, but they left welfare cuts and other difficult issues unresolved with Gov. Jerry Brown.

item.title: Woods shares US Open clubhouse lead with Furyk
item.description: Tiger Woods is in the clubhouse with a share of the U.S. Open lead.
item.media:text: Tiger Woods is in the clubhouse with a share of the U.S. Open lead.

item.title: France relish rain-soaked success over Ukraine
item.description: France's players revelled in the quality of their football after overcoming co-hosts Ukraine 2-0 to close to within touching distance of the Euro 2012 quarter-finals.
item.media:text: France's players revelled in the quality of their football after overcoming co-hosts Ukraine 2-0 to close to within touching distance of the Euro 2012 quarter-finals.

item.title: Paraguay: 17 killed in violent land dispute
item.description: Paraguay deployed its army Friday to resolve a violent land dispute in a remote northern forest reserve after 17 people were killed in gunbattles between police and landless farmers.
item.media:text: Paraguay deployed its army Friday to resolve a violent land dispute in a remote northern forest reserve after 17 people were killed in gunbattles between police and landless farmers.

item.title: Steven Powell gets 2 1/2 years for recording girls
item.description: The father-in-law of missing Utah woman Susan Powell was sentenced Friday to 2 1/2 years in prison for recording images of two neighbor girls in their bathroom in Washington state.
item.media:text: The father-in-law of missing Utah woman Susan Powell was sentenced Friday to 2 1/2 years in prison for recording images of two neighbor girls in their bathroom in Washington state.

item.title: Obama spares many young illegal immigrants deportation
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Hundreds of thousands of illegal immigrants who were brought into the United States as children will be able to avoid deportation and get work permits under an order on Friday by President Barack Obama. In a move that seemed to be aimed at Hispanics whose enthusiasm for voting in the November 6 election could be crucial to Obama's re-election chances, the president acted to potentially protect 800,000 people from deportation proceedings for at least two years. ...
item.media:text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Hundreds of thousands of illegal immigrants who were brought into the United States as children will be able to avoid deportation and get work permits under an order on Friday by President Barack Obama. In a move that seemed to be aimed at Hispanics whose enthusiasm for voting in the November 6 election could be crucial to Obama's re-election chances, the president acted to potentially protect 800,000 people from deportation proceedings for at least two years. ...

item.title: Woods shares US Open lead with Furyk
item.description: Tiger Woods has regained a share of the U.S. Open lead.
item.media:text: Tiger Woods has regained a share of the U.S. Open lead.

item.title: Obama interrupted during immigration remarks
item.description: President Barack Obama responded angrily to a reporter from a conservative online publication who interrupted him during remarks on immigration in the White House Rose Garden.
item.media:text: President Barack Obama responded angrily to a reporter from a conservative online publication who interrupted him during remarks on immigration in the White House Rose Garden.

item.title: Lawn chair balloonist to ride again, with co-pilot
item.description: Four years ago, Kent Couch made headlines by floating through the clouds in a lawn chair hoisted by party balloons from Oregon to Idaho. He's going to fly again, this time with a buddy sitting on a second lawn chair at his side.
item.media:text: Four years ago, Kent Couch made headlines by floating through the clouds in a lawn chair hoisted by party balloons from Oregon to Idaho. He's going to fly again, this time with a buddy sitting on a second lawn chair at his side.

item.title: Lockheed wins $490 million deal to buy F-35 parts
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Lockheed Martin Corp has won a U.S. contract worth $490 million to start buying parts, material and components for a seventh batch of 35 F-35 Joint Strike Fighter planes, the Pentagon announced on Friday. Lockheed, the Pentagon's largest supplier, welcomed the agreement and said it would help ensure that the $396 billion F-35 program, which has been restructured three times in recent years, continued to meet its production schedules. "This is an important milestone in paving the way for the acquisition of these aircraft," said Lockheed spokeswoman Laurie Quincy. ...
item.media:text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Lockheed Martin Corp has won a U.S. contract worth $490 million to start buying parts, material and components for a seventh batch of 35 F-35 Joint Strike Fighter planes, the Pentagon announced on Friday. Lockheed, the Pentagon's largest supplier, welcomed the agreement and said it would help ensure that the $396 billion F-35 program, which has been restructured three times in recent years, continued to meet its production schedules. "This is an important milestone in paving the way for the acquisition of these aircraft," said Lockheed spokeswoman Laurie Quincy. ...

item.title: Tiger grabs US Open leads, loses it to 17-year-old
item.description: As quick as Tiger Woods grabbed the U.S. Open lead he lost it.
item.media:text: As quick as Tiger Woods grabbed the U.S. Open lead he lost it.

item.title: Cuba lashes out at Gross health charges
item.description: Cuba lashed back Friday at what it called a campaign of distortions over the health of an imprisoned American contractor, and hinted at retaliation that could include transferring the 63-year-old man from the military hospital where he is being held to a regular prison.
item.media:text: Cuba lashed back Friday at what it called a campaign of distortions over the health of an imprisoned American contractor, and hinted at retaliation that could include transferring the 63-year-old man from the military hospital where he is being held to a regular prison.

item.title: Game 2 draws NBA Finals' best TV rating since 2004
item.description: The NBA Finals' Game 2 drew the highest television rating since 2004.

item.title: Streisand opens her home for women's heart health
item.description: In an elegant white tent at her oceanfront Malibu compound, Barbra Streisand sang and former President Bill Clinton spoke to a crowd gathered to raise funds for women's heart health.
item.media:text: In an elegant white tent at her oceanfront Malibu compound, Barbra Streisand sang and former President Bill Clinton spoke to a crowd gathered to raise funds for women's heart health.

item.title: McCain: Foreign cash sneaking in via super PACs
item.description: Sen. John McCain said in an interview posted online Friday that "foreign money" was helping fellow Republican Mitt Romney's presidential hopes and singled out one of his ally's most generous supporters.
item.media:text: Sen. John McCain said in an interview posted online Friday that "foreign money" was helping fellow Republican Mitt Romney's presidential hopes and singled out one of his ally's most generous supporters.

item.title: Kate Winslet, Kenneth Branagh get royal honors
item.description: Kate Winslet has been honored by Queen Elizabeth II for her titanic contribution to the arts.

item.title: Los Angeles County courts begin downsizing
item.description: The Los Angeles County court system began handing out layoff notices Friday as plunging budgets set in motion major reductions.
